skill.name: self-test
skill.description: Pattern for testing your own code during implementation. Ensures quality before declaring complete.
skill.summary: Pattern for testing your own code during implementation. Ensures quality before declaring complete.
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing a testing pattern for code implementation. No executable code, scripts, or network access. Contains only example bash commands for standard dev workflows (npm test, pytest, eslint).

content.value_statement: Catch issues early with an iterative testing workflow. Run tests, lint, and typecheck after each code change before declaring work complete.
actual_capabilities: Run specific test files or affected tests
Execute lint checks with automatic fixes
Run type checking for TypeScript or Python
Pre-complete checklist before marking work done
limitations: Does not create test files automatically
Relies on project-specific run-tests and lint skills
Requires existing test infrastructure in the project
Commands vary by programming language and framework

use_cases.title: Verify each code change
use_cases.description: Run tests after writing new code to catch bugs immediately.

use_cases.title: Catch issues early
use_cases.description: Use the test-lint-typecheck loop before moving to the next task.
Ensure code meets quality standards before integration.
use_cases.title: Maintain code quality

prompt_templates.title: Run tests after changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the tests for the file I just modified and report the results.

prompt_templates.title: Full verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run tests, lint, and typecheck on my recent changes and fix any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Specific test file
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the test file for {module_name} to verify the implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Continuous checking
prompt_templates.prompt: After each code change, run the self-test loop to ensure quality before proceeding.

output_examples.input: Run tests on my recent changes

best_practices: Run tests immediately after writing new code, not at the end
Fix failures right away instead of accumulating them
Use the complete checklist before marking work as pre-complete
anti_patterns: Batching all testing until the end of implementation
Ignoring test failures and continuing anyway
Skipping tests because the code seems to work

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Any language with test, lint, and typecheck tools including JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, and Rust.

faq.question: What if my project has no tests?
faq.answer: This skill requires existing test infrastructure. Set up tests first using your framework's testing tools.

faq.question: Can I use this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the same commands used locally (npm test, pytest) typically run in CI environments.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files and runs test commands you specify. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing after small changes?
faq.answer: This is the intended behavior. Small, incremental testing helps identify exactly which change introduced an issue.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual testing?
faq.answer: Automated tests run faster, catch regressions, and document expected behavior. Manual testing cannot match this reliability.
